4155.text: "this is important, this means something, this is important, this means something."

4162.text: Give yourself total permission, please. That's what the art world is, don't let yourself be policed

4170.text: in any way, shape, or form.

4175.text: or worse, you know, a psychopath.

4178.text: But in your work, you can be a sociopath.

4184.text: If Nabacough writes about Lolita, it does not make him a pedophile.

4191.text: If you think about rape, it doesn't mean you want to be raped, or you want to rape.

4196.text: We are in a new art world where if I violate the politically correct codes of our world,

4205.text: we are attacking ourselves, we are eating our young.

4209.text: Something is happening about certain kind of policing of our language.  Have any of you noticed that? I have,

4216.text: being in the center of a lot of storms.

4219.text: When I didn't like Oscar Murillo's work - Can I talk a little more, or is it time for questions?

4225.text: You know what? I'll keep blabbing, so I better stop.

4229.text: You nodded, yes, stop.  Your career is over!

4235.text: Alright, I'm going to drink some water,

4237.text: and I hope some of you have some questions. I'll tell you anything you want to know.

4242.text: How to get famous, what to do, where to go. Anything you ever want to know.

4246.text: Thank you for listening for the last hour.
